titlestmt.subtitle: Inventory of Records
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Connecticut State Library staff.

publicationstmt.p: Copyright © 2011 by the Connecticut State Library

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Paul E. Baran on July 27, 2011

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Kent, Litchfield County, Town established in October 1739

The Kent Probate District was constituted May 26, 1831, from the New Milford Probate District. The Kent Probate District merged with the Litchfield Probate District on January 3, 2007 to create an enlarged Litchfield Probate District. The Litchfield Probate District merged with the Harwinton, Northwest Corner, and Thomaston Probate Districts on January 5, 2011, to create the Litchfield Hills Probate District. The Litchfield Hills Probate District serves the municipalities of Canaan, Cornwall, Harwinton, Kent, Litchfield, Morris, Norfolk, North Canaan, Salisbury, Sharon, Thomaston, and Warren.
Town of Kent, Probate District chronology:

October 1739 - October 1742, Hartford District
October 1742 - October 1755, Litchfield District
October 1755 - May 1786, Litchfield District (covered only the East Greenwich Society of Kent, which became the Town of Warren in May 1786)
October 1755 - May 1787, Sharon District (covered the Town of Kent, except the East Greenwich Society)
May 1787 - May 25, 1831, New Milford District
May 26, 1831 - January 2, 2007, Kent District
January 3, 2007 - January 4, 2011, Litchfield District
January 5, 2011 - Present, Litchfield Hills District
For Probate Court contact information and hours of operation see, .

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Probate record books, None. Contact the probate court to access original record books. See Alternative Form Available note below.
Probate files, 1831-1928. Probate files may consist of estates, conservatorships, guardianships, commitments, and insolvencies. See Alternative Form Available note below.

Inventory control book, 1831-1928 (coverage). Also known as the Godard Digest, it is a list of probate files transferred to the Connecticut State Library. It was compiled at the Connecticut State Library under the direction of State Librarian George S. Godard.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Probate files are arranged alphabetically in one series.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aid
otherfindaid.p: Record Books: Index cards for the record books have been scanned. Ask History and Genealogy staff for assistance. Note: CSL does not hold any original record books. See Alternate Form Available section for volumes available on microfilm.

Probate Files: The Probate Estate Papers Index, located in the index corridor adjacent to the History and Genealogy Reading Room, has two parts, a general index covering most of the state, and a Hartford Probate District index covering Hartford and some surrounding towns, 1820-1920. The index cards are arranged alphabetically by individual's last name and first names. The cards have the individual's name, town of residence, probate district, and list of items contained in the estate packet. To request retrieval of an estate packet, copy at least the estate name, file date, and probate district name from the index card. The probate files in Accession 1914-005 are represented in this index.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Researchers should first consult use copies when available. See Alternate Form Available Section below.

Probate files from 1921-1928 are RESTRICTED as they may contain confidential documents. Tax returns (succession, transfer and estate tax returns and all attachments) from January 1, 1921 and later are confidential per Connecticut General Statutes §12-15. Contact State Archives staff for assistance.

altformavail.head: Alternative Form Available
altformavail.p: Record books, 1832-1929; probate files, 1831-1915; and inventory control book (Godard Digest) were microfilmed by the Genealogical Society of Utah and are available for use in the History and Genealogy reading room or through the .

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The probate files in accession 1914-005 were transferred to the Connecticut State Library on the following dates (with date span of files): October 5, 1914 (1831-1907); January 21, 1929 (1858-1928). They were interfiled into one alphabetic sequence.

note.p: Index of the two accessions of probate files now merged into accession 1914-005
Also known as the Godard Digest
